channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-975] ava.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space occures sometimes when installing bundles with cxf endpoints
item.description:
The following exception occurs sometimes, when trying to install camel-sap-example-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar attached here.

13:30:51,853 | ERROR | NAPSHOT-thread-1 | BlueprintContainerImpl           | 8 - org.apache.aries.blueprint.core - 1.0.1.redhat-610130 | Unable to start blueprint container for bundle camel-sap-example
 
org.osgi.service.blueprint.container.ComponentDefinitionException: Error when instantiating bean cxf of class class org.apache.cxf.bus.blueprint.BlueprintBus
 
	at org.apache.aries.blueprint.container.BeanRecipe.getInstance(BeanRecipe.java:333)[8:org.apache.aries.blueprint.core:1.0.1.redhat-610130]

The following exception occurs sometimes, when trying to install netty-cxf-jaxws-spring-ssl-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar attached here.

13:26:47,499 | ERROR | ExtenderThread-2 | ContextLoaderListener            | 137 - org.springframework.osgi.extender - 1.2.1 | Application context refresh failed (OsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=netty-cxf-jaxws-spring, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml))

item.summary: ava.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space occures sometimes when installing bundles with cxf endpoints

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Can you break SAP and netty issues out into separate jiras?

I can reproduce the issue by reduce the max PermGen memory space to 64MB and install bunch of camel features.
So it just a Fuse default setting issue. Maybe we can consider to increase the default max PermGen space.
BTW,
You can increase the max PermGen memory by setting the environment before starting the JBoss Fuse like this.

export JAVA_MAX_PERM_MEM=256M

Hello,
sorry for late reply.
You are right, I installed a lot of those examples -10 routes.

And I tried on Fuse version 130 and 136, and with increased max PermGen memory it still produces that exception on oracle java 1.6 and 1.7.
I also tried the following configuration:

export JAVA_MIN_MEM=512M
 
export JAVA_MAX_MEM=1024M
 
export JAVA_PERM_MEM=512M
 
export JAVA_MAX_PERM_MEM=1024M

Hi Elena,

The PermGen memory should be smaller than the JAVA memory.

Can you check if the JVM started with right setting?
You can just use the command if you are using linux or other unix.

ps -ef |grep java

And you can get the below information which shows if the parameter is passed rightly.

java -server -Xms256M -Xmx1024M -XX:+UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:+UnsyncloadClass -XX:PermSize=128M -XX:MaxPermSize=256M

emedvede 13324 2693 99 16:10 pts/1 00:03:06 /usr/bin/java -server -Xms128M -Xmx512M -XX:+UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:+UnsyncloadClass -XX:PermSize=16M -XX:MaxPermSize=128M

Hi Elena,

I use Jconsole to monitor the memory of JBoss Fuse and found when I install the features cxf-http-netty-client and cxf-http-netty-server, I can tell the memory size of PemGen is increased a lot.
I will keep digging the code to find out if there any resource are not released when uninstall the feature of cxf-http-netty-client and cxf-http-netty-server.

Regards,

Willem

Hi Elena,

I did some test and debug the code, I found if you uninstall the cxf-http-netty-server feature the CxfActivator of cxf-core will be initiated and it will go through the bundles to load extensions.
That can cause the PemGen memory increase 5M. If I just osgi:uninstall the cxf-http-netty-server bundle, the CxfActivator will not be initiated, the PemGen size doesn't change much.

I will keep digging the issue, at the meantime I just found a small issue of cxf-http-netty-server blueprint, so I just fill a JIRA SF-458 for it.

Hi Elena,
It is not a common practice to install and uninstall the system feature serval times.

I dug the code of karaf feature and found it will refresh the bundles which are effected by uninstall bundle. The Bundle refresh will cause the CxfActivator to load all the CXF bundle again and it also cause some bundle classloader memory leak in the PemGem of Oracle JDK.
There are some information about problem of PemGem

I'm still trying to figure out the reason why uninstall cxf-http-netty-server can cause the all the CXF bundles refresh, as cxf-rt-http-netty-server doesn't introduce the dependencies of other CXF bundles.

In the mean time the work around is don't uninstall the system feature and just uninstall the application bundle when you are doing the test.

Regards,

Willem

Hi Elena,

Which bundle did you uninstalled?
I don't suggest you to uninstall the System bundle such as cxf-rt-http-netty-server bundle, you can just uninstall the application bundle.

Hi Willem,

I uninstalled cxf-rt-http-netty-server bundle to avoid PermGen exception with uninstalling feature cxf-http-netty-server.

Hi Elena

I'm sorry I didn't make my comments clear.
Please don't uninstall the System level bundles or features, as they are not part of your application and uninstall them will cause some side effect such as OSGi bundle refreshing and class loader memory leak which could eat up the PermGen space.

Regards,

Willem
I think this is resolved. Solution: don't uninstall system bundles directly, you can uninstall the feature that contains them to make sure dependent bundles are also uninstalled.
